intro: Haemodorum brevisepalum, commonly known as the narrow-sheath everlasting, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, narrow, sheathing leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. It is native to southeastern Australia, where it thrives in rocky soils and open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and conservation status, it is often cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
